page.title: 15Community Police in Frimley
page.content: A policeman's job in Frimley is different from that of a Metropolitan policeman. He tries to help various groups of the community in their special needs, mainly by walking the beat and by visiting people, especially the elderly. Other problems may arise, such as chasing up information on burglaries or controlling traffic in the rush hour periods. On night shift he often needs to be on hand to cope with people who have drunk too much. We also have a policeman in each area who is responsible for contact with children and teachers in schools. He works long hours and aims to tackle any problems efficiently, but in a friendly manner. Often crime is prevented because he has built up a special relationship with people in his area.
